articles.content:

articles.title: World Cup: Argentina choose student halls instead of luxury hotel so they can have traditional beef barbeques
articles.description: The La Albiceleste will start their World Cup campaign against Saudi Arabia on November 22. They will then play Mexico and Poland on November 27 and December 1 respectively
articles.content:
Lionel Messi-led Argentina have opted to stay at student halls instead of the 5-star luxury hotels in Qatar so that they can carry on their tradition of having beef barbeques, the Daily Mail reports.

articles.title: UPDATE 1-IGC trims forecast for 2022/23 global wheat crop
articles.description: (Adds details)LONDON, Nov 17 (Reuters) - The International Grains Council (IGC) on Thursday trimmed its forecast for 2022/23 global wheat production by one million tonnes to 791 million tonnes.The downward revision was driven by a diminished outlook in Argentina where a crop of 13.0 million tonnes is now expected, down from a prior forecast of 17.5 million.The wheat crop in
articles.content:

articles.description: Over 5,000 fans from India march towards Argentina's World Cup base.
articles.content:
> Culture
The Indian fans of Argentina’s Football team waited for a long time in Qatar to see the bus in which Lionel Messi was seated. More than 500 people waited till 4 am just to get a glimpse of their favourite players. Lionel Messi’s team took a... [1548 chars]

articles.title: Lionel Messi's best chance to win a FIFA World Cup
articles.description: FIFA World Cup: With Lionel Messi in the team, Argentina will look to win their third title.
articles.content:
Aging but still one of the best players on the planet, Lionel Messi will lead Argentina in his fifth — and possibly — last World Cup.
And with him, Argentina certainly have a chance to win their third title.
